Perdagangan Bebas 16 Negara Masih Tunggu Kesepakatan India
05 Nov 2019, 08:51 by Yakob Arfin
Bangkok - Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) digadang-gadang akan menjadi blok perdagangan bebas terbesar di dunia, namun hingga kini pembentukannya masih menemui hambatan.
Dari enam belas negara yang akan tergabung dalam blok perdagangan bebas tersebut tinggal India yang belum bersepakat. Hal ini terkait kepentingan dari negara yang memiliki penduduk terbesar kedua di dunia itu.
Indonesia menilai India adalah partner penting dalam blok RCEP. Begitu pula negara-negara anggota lainnya yang akan bergabung dalam RCEP. Menteri Koordinator Perekonomian RI Airlangga Hartarto menyatakan pemerintah China juga menganggap India sangat penting untuk ikut memfinalisasi RCEP.
"Yang kritikal itu memang India, yang pending itu isu service maupun investment, tetapi sudah ada titik terang," kata Airlangga dalam keterangan tertulis, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Seperti diketahui India berkeinginan menjadi anggota RCEP. Apalagi negara-negara ASEAN yang menjadi mitra terpenting India juga masuk sebagai anggota RCEP.
Menteri Perdagangan Agus Suparmanto pun menyatakan hingga kini terus dilakukan perundingan antara negara-negara tersebut dengan India.
Pembahasan RCEP bahkan juga dibahas di sela-sela Konferensi Tingkat Tinggi (KTT) ke-35 ASEAN di Bangkok, Thailand. Agus menilai RCEP yang melibatkan sepuluh negara di Asia Tenggara dengan enam mitra perdagangan bebas masih menemui masalah 'kritikal'.
"Perundingan RCEP ini masih berlangsung. Nanti saya juga akan berunding lagi dengan menteri-menteri seluruh anggota RCEP," ungkap Agus.
Hingga saat ini volume perdagangan dari 16 negara calon anggota RECP mencapai US$11,5 triliun, sedangkan EU US$12,5 dan TPP US$5,8 triliun. Airlangga kembali mengungkapkan RCEP adalah blok terbesar melebihi Uni Eropa (EU).
"Memang kalau kita lihat, RCEP adalah blok terbesar melebihi Uni Eropa. EU itu PDB (total negara anggota) kira-kira US$18 triliun, kalau PDB RCEP itu US$ 27 triliun, sedangkan TPP (Trans Pacific Partnership) itu US$ 11 triliun," kata Airlangga.
Sementara itu jika bicara penduduk, tambah Airlangga, RCEP ini memiliki total sekitar 3,6 miliar jiwa.
"Jauh lebih besar daripada Uni Eropa dan PBB. Oleh karena itu, tadi hampir seluruh pemimpin itu mendorong agar perundingan ini bisa difinalisasi," kata Airlangga.
Seperti diketahui Indonesia merupakan negara pencetus perjanjian dagang Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) saat menjabat sebagai Ketua ASEAN pada tahun 2011.
Negara-negara yang tergabung dalam RCEP ini yakni Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapura, Filipina, Vietnam, Myanmar, Kamboja, Brunei Darussalalam, Laos, China, Jepang, Korea Selatan, India, Australia, dan Selandia Baru.

16 Free Trade Countries Still Waiting for India's Agreement
05 Nov 2019, 08:51 by Yakob Arfin
Bangkok - Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) is predicted to be the biggest free trade bloc in the world, but until now its formation still faces obstacles.
Of the sixteen countries that will be included in the free trade bloc, only India has yet to agree. This is related to the interests of the country which has the second largest population in the world.
Indonesia considers India to be an important partner in the RCEP block. Similarly, other member countries that will join the RCEP. Indonesian Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto said the Chinese government also considered India to be very important to finalize the RCEP.
"The critical thing is indeed India, which is a pending issue of service and investment, but there is already a bright spot," Airlangga said in a written statement on Tuesday (11/05/2019).
As is known, India wants to become a member of RCEP. Moreover, ASEAN countries which are India's most important partners are also included as RCEP members.
The Minister of Trade Agus Suparmanto also said that until now negotiations between these countries and India had continued.
The RCEP discussion was even discussed on the sidelines of the 35th ASEAN Summit in Bangkok, Thailand. Agus said that RCEP, which involved ten countries in Southeast Asia with six free trade partners, was still facing a 'critical' problem.
"The RCEP negotiations are still ongoing. Later I will also negotiate again with the ministers of all RCEP members," Agus said.
Until now, the trade volume of 16 prospective RECP member countries has reached US $ 11.5 trillion, while the EU is US $ 12.5 and TPP is US $ 5.8 trillion. Airlangga again revealed that RCEP is the largest block exceeding the European Union (EU).
"Indeed, if we see, RCEP is the largest block exceeding the European Union. The EU's GDP (total member countries) is approximately US $ 18 trillion, if RCEP's GDP is US $ 27 trillion, while TPP (Trans Pacific Partnership) is US $ 11 trillion "Airlangga said.
Meanwhile, when talking about population, added Airlangga, RCEP has a total of around 3.6 billion people.
"Much bigger than the European Union and the United Nations. Therefore, almost all of the leaders have pushed for this negotiation to be finalized," Airlangga said.
As is well known, Indonesia was the originator of the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) trade agreement when he was the Chair of ASEAN in 2011.
The countries which are members of the RCEP are Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore, the Philippines, Vietnam, Myanmar, Cambodia, Brunei Darussalalam, Laos, China, Japan, South Korea, India, Australia and New Zealand.
